questions.Question: What is the term used when you press and hold the left mouse key and move the mouse around the slide?
questions.solution: Solution:		Dragging is the term used when we press and hold the left mouse key and move the mouse around the slide. As we drag, a shadow object shows us where the object will land when we release the mouse button.

questions.Question: Which of the following toolbars provide different options in various master views?
questions.solution: Solution:		Common Tasks toolbar is located at the end of the Formatting toolbar. It provides the three commonly used command namely New Slides, Slide Layout and Apply Design in Powerpoint 2003 and earlier versions.

questions.Question: How can you create a uniform appearance by adding a background image to all slides?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Slide Master controls the properties of every slide in the presentation. All of the characteristics of the Slide Master (background color, text color , font, and font size) appear on every slide in the presentation. When you make a change on the Slide Master, the change affects every slide.

questions.Question: How do you create speaker note pages that show the slides, related notes, and your company logo on each page?

questions.optionB: Edit the slide master and insert your company logo and notes pane
questions.optionC: Edit the handout master to include your company logo and one slide per page with additional note space
questions.solution: Solution:		The Notes Master contains two placeholders one for your text and the other for the slide. We can move or change the size of either of these objects and we can change the format of the text in the notes placeholder, we can also add or change elements that we want to appear on each handout and also notice the convenient placement of the header, footer, date and page numbers.

questions.Question: Microsoft PowerPoint is a
questions.solution: Solution:		Microsoft PowerPoint (or simply PowerPoint) is a presentation program, created by Robert Gaskins and Dennis Austin at a software company named Forethought, Inc. It was released on April 20, 1987, initially for Macintosh computers only.Microsoft acquired PowerPoint for $14 million three months after it appeared. This was Microsoft's first significant acquisition and Microsoft set up a new business unit for PowerPoint in Silicon Valley where Forethought had been located. Source : wikipedia.org

questions.solution: Solution:		The Slide Master and Title Master for a template are called a slide-title master pair. The Slide Master controls the properties of every slide in the presentation. All of the characteristics of the Slide Master (background color, text color , font, and font size) appear on every slide in the presentation. When you make a change on the Slide Master, the change affects every slide.

questions.Question: Which of the following section does not exist in a slide layout?
questions.solution: Solution:		Slide layouts contain formatting, positioning, and placeholder boxes for all of the content that appears on a slide. Placeholders are the dotted-line containers on slide layouts that hold such content as titles, body text, tables, charts, SmartArt graphics, pictures, clip art, videos, and sounds. Slide layouts also contain the colors, fonts, effects, and the background (collectively known as the theme) of a slide.

questions.Question: What feature will you use to apply motion effects in between a slide exits and another enters?
questions.solution: Solution:		Slide transitions are the effects that occur when you move from one slide to the next during a presentation. You can control the speed, add sound, and customize the properties of transition effects.

questions.Question: The difference between Slide Design and Auto Content Wizard is
questions.optionB: Auto Content Wizard is just the wizard version of Slide Design
questions.optionC: Slide Design does not provide sample content but Auto Content Wizard provides sample content too!
questions.optionD: Slide Design asks your choice in steps but Auto Content Wizard does not let you make choices
questions.solution: Solution:		The AutoContent Wizard creates a new presentation using built-in templates, offering sample content ideas to help we organize the information we include on each slide. This feature is not available in Microsoft Office PowerPoint 2007 and higher versions. Instead, we can create our presentation quickly and easily by using templates. Slide Design provided different theme, variants, size which we need to apply as per our requirement. It does not provide sample content.

questions.Question: In which menu can you find features like Slide Design, Slide Layout etc.?
questions.solution: Solution:		In Format Menu we can find features like Slide Design, Slide Layout etc. in Powerpoint 2003 and earlier versions.

questions.Question: Which menu provides you options like Animation Scheme, custom Animation, Slide Transition?
questions.solution: Solution:		Slide Show Menu provides us options like Animation Scheme, custom Animation, Slide Transition in Powerpoint 2003 and earlier versions.

questions.Question: How many steps are there between Start and Finish in AutoContent Wizard?
questions.solution: Solution:		The AutoContent Wizard creates a new presentation using built-in templates, offering sample content ideas to help we organize the information we include on each slide. It has three steps between Start and Finish, Presentation Type, Presentation Style and Presentation options. This feature is not available in Microsoft Office PowerPoint 2007 and higher versions. Instead, we can create our presentation quickly and easily by using templates.

questions.Question: In slide layout panel how many layouts are available for text layout by default?
questions.solution: Solution:		In MS Powerpoint 2003 and earlier versions, there are 4 Layouts are available by default for text layout.In MS Powerpoint 2007 and higher versions, there are 9 Layouts are available as office theme in slide layout panel.

questions.Question: Which of the following statement is false?

questions.optionC: Blank Slide is at the top of the ‘Content Layouts’ area in the Slide Layout panel
questions.optionD: All of above are false statements
questions.solution: Solution:		If we choose to select from the pre-made slide layouts, we cannot delete the objects in the layout is wrong sentence. We can delete the objects and make changes accordingly.

questions.Question: What lets you to create new presentation by selecting ready-made font color and graphics effects?
questions.solution: Solution:		A PowerPoint template is a pattern or blueprint of a slide or group of slides that you save as a .potx file. Templates can contain layouts, theme colors, theme fonts, theme effects, background styles, and even content. You can create your own custom templates and store them, reuse them, and share them with others. Additionally, you can find many different types of free templates built-in to PowerPoint. You can search for templates that are right for your presentation when you go to File > New in PowerPoint. Source : office.com

questions.Question: Which command will you use in PowerPoint if you need to change the color of different objects without changing content?
questions.solution: Solution:		Each Microsoft PowerPoint theme includes a built-in color scheme to apply to your slides. If you don’t like the available choices, you can create custom color schemes in PowerPoint to use in your presentation.

questions.Question: What PowerPoint feature will you use to apply motion effects to different objects of a slide?
questions.solution: Solution:		An animation scheme is just a predefined slide transition and a collection of animation effects applied to slide objects.
